definition: to be busy (colloquial)
busy/hurriedly/to hurry/to rush
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)

sentences.english: The hound hunted all night. He quit when the roosters started crowing at daybreak.
sentences.chinese: 那隻獵犬忙乎了整晚，到黎明公雞報曉時才休息。

sentences.english: I'm busy enough as it is without your making extra demands on me.
sentences.chinese: 即使你不向我提出種種額外要求我都已經是夠忙乎的。

sentences.english: But I was busy and did not pay attention.
sentences.chinese: 我卻在忙乎，什麼也沒有聽到。

sentences.english: Busy half-day, did not drink a water.
sentences.chinese: 忙乎了半天，開水也沒喝上一口。

sentences.english: We are all busy taking about and using the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 人們忙乎於談論和使用着互聯網。
一直忙乎，您的生意做得怎麼樣？

definition: to be really busy/pressing business
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to rush/in a hurry/to worry about being late
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
busy/hurriedly/to hurry/to rush
to be occupied with (doing sth)
to buy and sell/peddling
to turn over sth repeatedly
rushed and muddled
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
in a busy and hasty manner
to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
feet not touching the ground (idiom)/to run like the wind
to move/to shift/to exchange/to buy and sell/peddling
to have more work than one can deal with/to have one's hands full
to puff and blow/to whimper
to tinker with/to incite
